content:
• Tuesday, March 28, 2017
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharma to seek approval of new cystic fibrosis drug

    • Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) +6.3% AH after saying it would apply for regulatory approval in the U.S. and European Union for an experimental cystic fibrosis drug after the treatment significantly improved lung function in late-stage trials.
    • The drug is intended to treat patients who have one or two copies of a genetic mutation that is the most common cause of cystic fibrosis, a progressive lung disease that affects ~30K people in the U.S.
    • If approved, the new drug would present patients with an alternative to the company's drug Orkambi, which can cause chest tightness and other side effects that have led to disappointing sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM | 7 Comments
  • RH

    RH jumps 15.9% on Q4 beat, robust revenue guidance

    • Restoration Hardware parent RH (RH +3.6%) is up 15.9% after hours after reporting Q4 earnings where revenues declined less than expected and the company forecast robust growth ahead.
    • "We are now through the most uncertain stages of our transformation," says CEO Gary Friedman, who said a temporary depression in financial results will strengthen the brand ahead.
    • While adjusted net revenues fell 9%, comparable brand revenues were down 18%. Adjusted net income fell to $27.9M from a year-ago $41.2M.
    • The company's guiding to Q1 revenue growth of 16-20% ($530M-$545M, well above consensus for $485M), with 5 points coming from accelerated inventory optimization and another 5 from the acquisition of Waterworks. The revenue boost will have a negative effective on margins and earnings, it says, forecasting net income of $0.8M-$2.4M (EPS of $0.02-$0.06 vs. consensus for $0.05).
    • For the full year it sees revenues of $2.3B-$2.4B (8-12% growth, and vs. consensus for $2.32B) and EPS of $1.78-$2.19 vs. an expected $1.94.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 7 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: RH +17.8%. VRNT +8.2%. ITCI +2.2%. WPX +1.7%. AUPH +1.7%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: PTX -11.7%. DEPO -5.4%. PLAY -4.2%. AVP -3.5%. SONC -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • DRWI

    DragonWave +26% after Knoxville agency win

    • DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) is again on the move (up 25.9% in postmarket trading) after touting a customer win.
    • The Knoxville Utilities Board has chosen its Harmony Enhanced MC backhaul solution, the company says. The agency, independent of the city of Knoxville, Tenn., will use the radios to extend existing fiber/wireline facilities into a hybrid wireless/wireline network.
    • Shares have jumped after hours from time to time after customer contract wins, but YTD the stock is down 48%.
    • DragonWave plans an April 5 webinar to discuss the utility use case.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • ATHX

    William Blair sees Athersys as nearly a 10-bagger; shares +16% in post-market

    • via Notable Calls
    • Athersys' (NASDAQ:ATHX) MultiStem is a potentially revolutionary stroke treatment, says William Blair, initiating coverage with an $11 price target - this vs. today's close of $1.18.
    • The team at Blair sees peak sales potential of $3.9B against the company's current market cap of just $133M.
    • Shares +16.1% after hours to $1.37.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 34 Comments
  • PTX

    Pernix Q4 top line down 35%, operating loss widens; shares off 9% after hours

    • Nano cap Pernix Therapeutics (NYSEMKT:PTX) slips 9% after hours on the heels of its release of Q4 and 2016 results. Q4 revenues were $30.1, down 35% from a year ago. EBITDA was ($53.9M) down from a loss of ($23.1). Treximet Q4 sales of $8.8M were down 67% and down 34% ($66.9M) for the year.
    • Net revenues of Treximet for the year were negatively impacted by $15.3 million of disputed rebate claims, which were recorded during 2016 for sales which occurred in prior periods ($12.5 million and $2.8 million for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively) related to the unfavorable arbitration ruling in its dispute with GlaxoSmithKline.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 20 Comments
  • VRNT

    Verint Systems +7.5% as Q4 earnings come in hot

    • Verint Systems (VRNT -1.1%) has stepped up 7.5% after the bell after posting Q4 earnings that beat on top and bottom lines as revenues grew steadily in both key segments.
    • Operating income came to $19.4M ($72.4M on a non-GAAP basis) in what the company acknowledges is typically the year's strongest quarter.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $124.3M (up 7.9%); Service and Support, $171.5M (up 3.6%). By segment (non-GAAP): Customer Engagement, $190.5M (up 6%); Cyber Intelligence, $109M (up 6.8%).
    • For the coming year, Verint is guiding to mid-single digit revenue growth in Customer Engagement, and high single digits in Cyber Intelligence, leading to forecasts of $1.14B in revenue plus or minus 2% (vs. consensus for $1.13B) and EPS at the midpoint of $2.70 (vs. consensus $2.71).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • ALQA

    Alliqua Bio readies equity offering; shares slip 17% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap Alliqua BioMedical (NASDAQ:ALQA) is off 17% after hours on average volume in response to its announcement of a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced. Net proceeds will fund working capital and general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • ASRT

    Depomed inks cooperative deal with activist investor to shake-up board and name new CEO; shares down 6% after hours on soft Q1 guidance

    • Depomed (DEPO) and activist investor Starboard Value LP have reached an agreement on new leadership for the company. Former Bayer Healthcare CEO Arthur Higgins has been appointed President & CEO.
    • Mr. Higgins, former Barr Pharmaceuticals CFO William McKee and Starboard partner Gavin Molinelli have joined the board. Directors Samuel Saks, M.D. and David Zenoff, D.B.A., have resigned. Currently director James Fogarty will be the new Chairman.
    • Separately, the company expects top-line revenues for Q1 of $95M - 100M. Management will update its 2017 guidance during its earnings call the week of May 8.
    • Shares are off 6% after hours on increased volume in response to the soft revenue guidance. The midpoint represents a yoy decrease of 7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 32 Comments
  • OLLI

    Post-earnings gain for Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings

    • Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings (NASDAQ:OLLI) is higher after topping consensus estimates with its FQ4 report.
    • Comparable sales were up 2.0% to match consensus and total sales increased 16% to $283M on a higher store count.
    • The company's gross profit rate was down 60 bps to 40.0%. Cost of sales were up 60 bps to 60.0% of sales. Net income came in at 8.6% of sales vs. 6.6% a year ago.
    • "Very strong deal flow, consistent performance across all stores and tight expense control helped drive strong bottom line results," says CEO Mark Butler.
    • Previously: Ollie's Bargain Outlet beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (March 28)
    • OLLI +3.32% premarket to $34.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • PLAY

    Comparable sales a bit short for Dave & Buster's

    • Dave & Buster's Entertainment (NASDAQ:PLAY) trades lower after coming up short with sales at existing stores in Q4.
    • The company reports comparable sales increased 3.1% during the quarter vs. +3.7% consensus and +6% a year ago.
    • Adjusted EBITDA increased 30 bps Y/Y to 27.6% of sales during the quarter.
    • The company expects FY17 revenue of $1.16B to $1.17B vs. $1.16B consensus off of comparable sales growth of 2% to 3%. 11 to 12 store openings are expected this year.
    • "Our consistent performance and industry-leading margins position us well for our next growth phase. At the same time, our free cash flow and strong balance sheet allow flexibility to return value to shareholders in additional ways, including share repurchases," says CFO Brian Jenkins.
    • Previously: Dave & Buster's beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (March 28)
    • PLAY -5.61% AH to $58.70.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • OLLI

    Ollie's Bargain Outlet beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Ollie's Bargain Outlet (NASDAQ:OLLI): Q4 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $283.4M (+16.4% Y/Y) beats by $3.02M.
    • Shares +2.57%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • SONC

    Sales drop at Sonic worse than anticipated

    • Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC) reports same-store sales fell 7.4% in FQ2 as the chain lost market share. Analysts expected same-store sales to be down about 4.5%.
    • Drive-in margins at company-owned stores fell 210 bps during the quarter. Food and packaging costs at company drive-ins as a percentage of sales fell 10 bps to 27.4%. Payroll and employee benefits were up 230 bps to 39.4% of sales.
    • Sonic store count +34 Y/Y to 3,562.
    • "Our second quarter results reflect a sluggish consumer environment, weather headwinds and share losses following exceptionally strong performance over the prior two years," notes Sonic CEO Cliff Hudson.
    • Guidance: The company forecasts FY17 same-store sales growth of -2% to 0%. Drive-in-level margins are seen falling in a range of 15.5% to 16.0% vs. 16% to 17% pior view. Sonic expects to open 65 to 75 new franchised drive-in locations during the year.
    • Previously: Sonic beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (March 28)
    • SONC -4.26% AH to $22.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • RH

    RH beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • RH (NYSE:RH): Q4 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $586.7M (-9.3% Y/Y) beats by $1.7M.
    • Shares +8%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 6 Comments
  • CRTO

    A shot in publisher/ad-tech war: Guardian sues Rubicon Project

    • The Guardian newspaper is suing the Rubicon Project (RUBI -1.7%), charging that the ad-tech firm didn't disclose its buyer fees when pursuing Guardian inventory.
    • It's a spillover of tension between ad-tech and publishing as programmatic ads take over display advertising, crimping publishers' takes to make more revenue room for data vendors.
    • In the Guardian's case, the paper ran an investigation of its inventory to find it was receiving 30 pence for each pound's worth of programmatic ads. And 80% of its digital display inventory was sold that way over the past three months.
    • Rubicon Project responds: "“Without buyer fees we would need to charge sellers more, and we think our approach is fair ... We split our fees between sellers and buyers, reflecting the value we provide to both.”
    • Also lower today: CRTO -2.5%, FUEL -3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • GG

    Goldcorp -7% as investors cool to costs of Chilean joint venture with Barrick

    • Goldcorp (GG -6.9%) plunges nearly 7% after committing nearly $1B, including ~$445M in upfront costs, to a joint venture with Barrick Gold (ABX -2.6%) that will see the companies own and operate at least three properties in Chile’s Maricunga region.
    • The announcements are a “slight strategic negative” for GG, according to Goldman Sachs' Andrew Quail, saying the deals highlight the company’s "lack of large-scale organic growth projects when compared to its peers” such as ABX and Newmont Mining; the deal is “strategically neutral” for ABX, Quail says, but could become positive as it represents a move toward risk-sharing among large miners.
    • For GG, investors are unsure whether what was likely to be a big capital project would have a high enough rate of return, Gabelli Gold Fund research analyst Chris Mancini says, adding that development partnerships could make sense on other big gold projects, such as Seabridge Gold's (SA -0.4%) KSM project in Canada and Northern Dynasty's (NAK -3.5%) Pebble deposit in Alaska.
    • The impact of the deal on GG is “neutral to slight positive," GMP Securities' Steven Butler says, as the purchase prices look reasonable but much depends on future direction of commodity prices, capex estimates, timing of development and competition with other projects.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 24 Comments
  • RCAR

    RenovaCare reports FY16 results

    • RenovaCare (OTCPK:RCAR): FY16 EPS of -$0.03 vs. -$0.02 in FY15
    • Cash and equivalents of $0.42M
    • Shares +3%.
    • Press Release
    • See important disclosures.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 5 Comments
  • DFFN

    Diffusion Pharma up 60% on new patent covering lead product candidate TSC

    • Thinly traded nano cap Diffusion Pharmaceuticals (DFFN +60.2%) is up on a healthy 16x surge in volume in response to the news that it has secured a new patent covering lead product candidate Trans Sodium Crocetinate (TSC).
    • Orphan Drug-tagged TSC is a small molecule that modifies the tumor microenvironment which improves the effectiveness of radiation therapy and chemotherapy.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • CMC

    Commercial Metals upgraded to Outperform at Credit Suisse

    • Commercial Metals (NYSE:CMC) surges higher after Credit Suisse upgrades shares to Outperform from Neutral with a $24 price target, raised from $19, saying CMC should see "significant" EBITDA growth during 2017-19, driven by solid volume growth and metal spread expansion.
    • The firm sees a rebound in global rebar markets driven by capacity rationalization in China, accelerating global demand and lower export volumes from China.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy +3% after bullish view from Wunderlich analyst

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.2%) powers higher in active trading as Wunderlich analyst Jason Wrangler reiterates a Buy rating and $10 price target on the shares, citing "compelling valuation alongside natural gas exposure, oil growth and an improving balance sheet."
    • CHK’s early results from its Powder River Basin and Mid-Continent plays are "positive developments as the company ramps activity in the areas with a focus on driving oil growth going forward," Wrangler writes.
    • The analyst notes that CHK recently posted a 1,650 boe/day (70% oil) Niobrara well test on its Powder River Basin assets, "a good start" as the company ramps up operations in the region.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 69 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: IZEA +26%. GRVY +22%. DRAM +11%. OTC:PRKR +10%. COOL +10%.
    • Losers: SCON -17%. NIHD -9%. EMAN -9%. DGLY -8%. INAP -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • TS

    Tenaris +5% on bullish outlook for global oil tubes market

    • Tenaris (TS +5.6%) jumps after lifting its 2017 demand estimate for global tubular goods used in oil and gas production to 12.1M metric tons from a previous forecast of 10.4M tons and 2016 demand of 8.8M tons.
    • TS sees demand this year in the U.S. and Canada reaching 5.2M metric tons, up from 2.2M last year, demand from China and Russia rising to 3.7M tons from 3.5M a year ago, and demand in other areas remaining stable.
    • The new guidance could result in a double-digit upgrade to analyst earnings estimates for TS, a trader tells Reuters.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: XRA +53%. MBII +10%. BCEI +11%. REI +10%. SDRL +9%.
    • Losers: GBR -20%. GSV -11%. GEVO -9%. GG -7%. RIC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 8 Comments
  • NSM

    Nationstar Mortgage up nearly 7% after positive coverage

    • Wedbush buys the dip, initiating coverage with an Outperform rating with the $19 price target suggesting more than 25% upside from yesterday's close.
    • This year should be a "transitional" one for Nationstar (NSM +6.7%), says analyst Henry Coffey, with the benefits of its growth strategy becoming more apparent in 2018.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • The specialty servicer sector as a whole is lit up bright green, including Ocwen Financial (OCN +7.4%), which took another big step towards cutting cots, and once again being a buyer of MSRs, courtesy of last night's announced settlement with the NYDFS.
    • One beneficiary should be Altisource Portfolio Solutions (ASPS +7.3%) which should see more business if Ocwen moves back into growth mode.
    • Walter Investment (WAC +19%), New Residential (NRZ +1.3%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 13 Comments
  • TDW

    Tidewater +11% as it stops seeking more waiver extensions

    • Tidewater (TDW +11%) posts strong gains after saying it will not seek renewal of limited waivers from its lenders and noteholders following yesterday's expiration of the latest one.
    • TDW has been in talks since last year with its principal lenders and noteholders to amend its various debt arrangements to obtain relief from certain covenants.
    • TDW CEO Jeffrey Platt says work remains to resolve "a small number of issues" and to obtain board approval as well as final approval from the various financial institutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 32 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CBIO +203%. XRA +54%. AKER +52%. DFFN +40%. OTCPK:PSIX +27%. GRVY +25%. SSH +23%. IMMY-OLD +18%. OSIR +18%. KBSF +18%.
    • Losers: CYRX -45%. HTGM -25%. APOP -24%. CGIX -20%. GBR -16%. VSR -16%. XELB -16%. EMAN -13%. SCON -12%. INAP -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • IBA

    Bachoco on watch after large recall

    • Shares of Industrias Bachoco (IBA -0.6%) are on watch after the company recalls almost 1M pounds of OK Foods breaded chicken products being sold in the U.S. under different brand names.
    • Bachoco acquired Arkansas-based OK Foods in 2011.
    • Department of Agriculture press release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MTNB

    Matinas Bio adds to trial-related gains

    • Matinas BioPharma (MTNB +2%) yesterday reported positive topline data from its Phase 1 study of MAT2501.
    • Trading at $1.65 late on Friday afternoon, shares are currently changing hands at $2.65.
    • See important disclosures.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • AUPH

    Aurinia continues intermediate correction from voclosporin-stoked run-up; shares ease 9%

    • Aurinia Pharmaceuticals (AUPH -8.5%) continues its correction from the three-fold up move that started at the beginning of the month after it reported positive results from a Phase 2b study of voclosporin in patients with lupus nephritis (LN). Shares are down over 33% from the peak of $10.54 on March 13.
    • This morning, SA published an article on the company from first-time Contributor Element Capital Research that raises questions about the efficacy of calcineurin inhibitors in LN and potential risks to the success of the Phase 3 study if renal biopsies are required since it would make it more difficult to prove voclosporin works.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 19 Comments
  • IMASY

    RBC raises Inmarsat to Outperform

    • Inmarsat (OTCPK:IMASY) has gotten boosted to Outperform by RBC Capital Markets, from a previous Outperform.
    • Analyst Wilton Fry raised his price target on the satcom provider to 1,000 pence from 760 pence, implying 23% upside from current price.
    • Shares closed up 2.6% today in London.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • PSIX

    Power Solutions upgraded to Hold at Lake Street on Chinese investment

    • Power Solutions International (OTCPK:PSIX +25.5%) is upgraded to Hold from Sell with a $9 price target at Lake Street, which says the strategic investment by Weichai has removed the risk of bankruptcy.
    • Lake Street says the deal also adds the largest engine manufacturer in China as a strategic partner that accelerates PSIX's efforts in China and results in sourcing and manufacturing synergies.
    • The firm thinks Weichai's $8/share valuation price of the investment - a 25% premium to yesterday's closing price - is an attractive valuation of 9x EV/EBITDA based on its 2017 EBITDA estimate.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: KBSF +18%. RELV +9%. FFHL +6%. VNCE +6%.
    • Losers: CYRX -45%. FORD -7%. SNAK -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings +14% to break out of single digits

    • Sears Holdings (SHLD) is up 13.5% on elevated volume to swing back over $10 after yesterday's news of insider buying by Eddie Lampert and Fairholme Capital Management instills a bit of confidence.
    • Execs with Sears continue to defend its SEC filing shocker last week as "in line" with regulatory standards.
    • Previously: Sears Holdings breaks higher (March 27)
    • Previously: Mall store closing blitz continues (March 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 54 Comments
  • REGN

    FDA OKs Regeneron and Sanofi's dermatitis med Dupixent

    • The FDA approves Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -1.7%) and Sanofi's (SNY +1.1%) Dupixent (dupilumab) for the treatment of adults with moderate-to-severe atopic dermatitis (AD).
    • Dupixent is a human monoclonal antibody that is designed to specifically inhibit overactive signaling of two key proteins, IL-4 and IL-13, which are believed to be major drivers of the persistent underlying inflammation in AD. Dupixent comes in a pre-filled syringe and can be self-administered as a subcutaneous injection every other week after an initial loading dose.
    • The wholesale acquisition cost (WAC) in the U.S. will be $37K/year.
    • The FDA accepted the BLA in late September under Priority Review.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 9 Comments
  • GEGYF

    Genel Energy again cuts reserves estimate for key field

    • Genel Energy's (OTCPK:GEGYF -14.4%) market value plunges to an all-time low after saying again that its flagship Taq Taq oilfield in Iraqi Kurdistan contains less crude than expected.
    • Genel cuts its reserves estimate for its largest operational field, by nearly two-thirds to 59M barrels of oil, down from 172M barrels in 2015 and 683M in 2011, adding that it will book a $181M impairment in 2016; the company also is suspending its 2017 gross average production forecast for the field.
    • Production at Taq Taq continues to decline, with the field now producing ~19K bbl/day of oil, down from 36K at the end of 2016 and initial expectations of as much as 80K bbl/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 8 Comments
  • BSBR

    Banco Santander Brasil slumps after share sale

    • Qatar Holdings is selling 80M share certificates, which could be increased by another 12M ADSs.
    • BSBR -6.55%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • MDIUY

    Telecom Italia auditors: Vivendi's influence at company strong

    • Vivendi (VIVHY +0.4%), top shareholder at Telecom Italia (TI +1.6%), is in a position to influence board members at the telecom even without de facto control of the company, TI Chairman Giuseppe Recchi told Italy's Senate.
    • That's according to what auditors told TI, Recchi said, promising other details on what the auditors had to say to the company.
    • Italy's government has taken a strong interest in growing influence by the French media giant. Aside from antitrust rules limiting shares in both telecom and media, it considers some Italian companies of national interest, and Vivendi's significant stake in Mediaset (OTCPK:MDIUY) has led to speculation about whether it plans to combine the companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: CBIO +229%. AKER +50%. OMER +24%. OSIR +23%. SELB +15%.
    • Losers: HTGM -24%. APOP -21%. CGIX -20%. AUPH -10%. RGLS -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • HMCBF

    Home Capital Group fires CEO; shares down more than 7%

    • Martin Reid has been fired as CEO of the Canadian mortgage lender less than a year after taking on the job. His termination is effective immediately.
    • The move comes amid a probe into fraudulent mortgage documents allegedly prepared by some of the company's mortgage brokers.
    • "Home Capital (OTCPK:HMCBF) requires leadership that can bring to bear a renewed operational discipline, emphasis on risk management and controls, and focus on improving performance,” says Chairman Kevin Smith.
    • The stock's down 7.1% in Toronto action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 17 Comments
  • SBLK

    Rally time for shipping stocks

    • There's a rally in shipping stocks after Morgan Stanley entered the fray earlier today with a series of upgrades of dry bulk names.
    • Gainers across the broad shipping sector include Star Bulk Carriers (SBLK +15.1%), Safe Bulkers (SB +14.8%), Genco Shipping & Trading (GNK +11.7%), DryShips (DRYS +8.2%), Golden Ocean Group (GOGL +6.9%), Scorpio Tankers (STNG +5.5%), DHT Holdings (DHT +5%), Global Ship Lease (GSL +5.9%), Seaspan (SSW +4.2%), Navios Maritime Partners (NMM +6.2%), Navios Maritime Acquisition (NNA +3.5%) and Eagle Bulk Shipping (EGLE +2.6%).
    • An improved outlook on freight shipping rates is helping to boost sentiment.
    • Related ETF: SEA.
    • Previously: Morgan Stanley upgrades trio of dry bulk shippers (March 28)
    • Previously: Genco Shipping & Trading catches an upgrade (March 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 49 Comments
  • AKER

    U.S. commercialization of Akers Bio's rapid cholesterol self-test commences; shares ahead 61%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Akers Biosciences (AKER +60.7%) jumps on a healthy 28x surge in volume in response to its announcement that exclusive U.S. distributor First Check Diagnostics, LLC has placed an initial order for its Tri-Cholesterol rapid self-test.
    • First Check products are sold through major retailers such as CVS, Rite Aid, Target and Kmart.
    • Tri-Cholesterol is a disposable screening test that estimates a person's total cholesterol, high density lipoprotein cholesterol and low density lipoprotein cholesterol. It generates a result in five minutes from a finger-stick blood sample.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 18 Comments
  • WWE

    WWE, StubHub ink multi-year ticket resale deal

    • WWE (WWE +2%) has come to a multi-year deal with StubHub, making the reseller its exclusive ticket resale marketplace in the U.S. and Canada.
    • It's the first secondary ticket partner for the wrestling league.
    • The company notes the deal is in place in time for WrestleMania 33 this coming Sunday in Orlando, Fla.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • INFO

    IHS Markit up 2.9% after Q1 report shows revenue progress

    • IHS Markit (NASDAQ:INFO) has risen 2.9% in early going after its fiscal Q1, an in-line report that included new financial-services revenue from the now-merged company.
    • Revenues were up 54% on an as-reported basis; organic revenue was up 1%, and normalized organic revenue up 2%.
    • EBITDA came in at $320M, beating an expected $318M. Cash flow from operations was $251M; free cash flow came to $179M.
    • Revenue by segment: Resources, $196.9M (down 9%); Transportation, $224.9M (up 13%); CMS, $126.5M (down 5%); Financial Services, $295.M (new).
    • Revenue by type: Recurring fixed, $617.1M (up 39%); Recurring variable, $106.4M (new); non-recurring, $120.7M (up 15%).
    • For full 2017, the company is guiding to revenue of $3.49B-$3.56B (vs. consensus for $3.53B), adjusted EBITDA of $1.375B-$1.4B (vs. expected $1.385B), and EPS of $2.02-$2.08 (vs. consensus for $2.06).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • CYRX

    Cryoport prices stock offering at $2.00; shares down 44%

  • GG

    Goldcorp to team with Barrick to consolidate Cerro Casale, Caspiche projects

    • Goldcorp (NYSE:GG) and Barrick Gold (ABX) say they are forming a 50-50 joint venture to study building gold mines in Chile's Maricunga belt, including the Cerro Casale project, which is one of the world's biggest undeveloped gold deposits.
    • In a series of deals costing GG ~$445M upfront in cash and shares, the miner agrees to acquire Kinross Gold's (NYSE:KGC) 25% stake in Cerro Casale and all of its Quebrada Seca exploration project for an initial $260M in cash.
    • GG also agrees to buy junior miner Exeter Resource (NYSEMKT:XRA) and its Caspiche project, located just six miles from Cerro Casale, for ~$185M in shares.
    • Finally, GG also will buy a 25% stake in Cerro Casale from ABX, reducing ABX's holding in the project to 50% from 75%; GG will pay for the stake by funding all initial expenditures on Cerro Casale and by contributing the Caspiche project into the joint venture.
    • Cerro Casale contains proven and probable reserves of 23.2M oz. of gold, 58.7M oz. of silver and 5.8B lbs. of copper.
    • XRA +57.7%, KGC +4.6%, ABX -0.1%, GG -1.5% premarket.

    • CB-1158 inhibits an enzyme called arginase that is found in myeloid-derived suppressor cells which plays a key role in suppressing the immune system's anti-tumor activity. Specifically, it depletes the amino acid arginine in the tumor microenvironment and prevents the activation of the immune system's cytotoxic T cells and NK (natural killer) cells.

  • CARA

    Cara's lead product candidate successful in mid-stage study; shares ahead 15% premarket

    • Results from Part A of a Phase 2/3 clinical trial assessing Cara Therapeutics' (NASDAQ:CARA) lead product candidate I.V. CR845 in patients with uremic pruritus (UP) met both primary and secondary endpoints.
    • The primary endpoint was the change from baseline in mean worst itching score at week 8 as measured by a 0 -10 Numeric Rating Scale (NRS). Patients receiving I.V. CR845 showed a 68% reduction compared to placebo (p<0.0019).
    • The secondary endpoint assessed quality-of-life metrics using a scale called Skindex-10 score. Patients in the treatment group experienced a 100% greater reduction from baseline in average Skindex-10 score compared to placebo (p<0.0007).
    • I.V. CR845 was well-tolerated over the eight-week treatment period with no new safety signals observed. The most common adverse events were transient paresthesia (mid-facial tingling or numbness) and dizziness.
    • The company plans to schedule an end-of-Phase 2 meeting with the FDA to review the results and determine the optimal dose for the Phase 3 and define the path to approval. The Phase 3 protocol will assess I.V. 845 administered 3x/week after dialysis over a 12-week treatment period in up to 240 patients with moderate-to-severe UP.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 8:30 am ET to discuss the data.
    • Shares are up 15% premarket on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM | 15 Comments
